comment.body:
На сколько видно из журнала фильтрации - этот встроенная реклама. Если заблокировать запрос, то можно нарушить работу приложения. 
Если вы используете private dns от AdGuard, то блокировать запросы можно в разделе Настройки сервера --> Пользовательские правила

pull_request.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [ ] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [x] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

### Enter the issue address



### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located





1. Your comment


https://github.com/easylist/easylist/commit/6666794984fef155989448f92a7737486f5c6d10#diff-466ed2d80c7d258f05a46cf98b323d6c01de494e5805cb8a8a0ae6c4d0ab9ec6L451

`/adRunner.js` removed from the EasyList.

---

https://github.com/easylist/easylist/blob/6f9d7149f274ce22fd32a4949aded1dfb63f5e8a/easylist/easylist_general_block.txt#L2312

The `/prebid8.` rule from EasyList is enough.

---

WowTurkey has stopped its operations

`http://wowturkey.com/`

---




### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

pull_request.title: Update Instacart filter
pull_request.body:
# Creating the pull request

Instacart updated their website layout slightly, so the existing rule does not work anymore to block individual Sponsored products. This PR fixes the rule. Tested on both desktop and mobile.



## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [x] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [ ] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

### Enter the issue address

https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/160129

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

0. **DO NOT** upload screenshots with sexually explicit material on GitHub directly.\
 Instead, upload it to a third-party image hosting and post the link to it without preview (!) here.\
 Also, mention if the link leads to NSFW content;

1. Add screenshots of the problem. You can drag and drop images or paste them from clipboard

    Use `<details> </details>` tag to hide screenshots under the spoiler;

2. Describe the issue in detail until it is absolutely clear from the screenshot what the problem is

    You can also indicate any other information that you think the developers should know.

**Warning:** Please remove personal information before uploading screenshots!

1. Your comment

<!-- Please write a comment here -->

2. Screenshots

<details>

<summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

<details>

<summary>Screenshot N:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -2097,6 +2097,7 @@ porntrex.com#?#.content > div[class]:has(> div[style*="text-align"] > center > s
 freshnewsasia.com#?#div[itemprop="articleBody"] > div[style]:has(> a[href*="/banner/"])
 freshnewsasia.com#?#.row-fluid > div#aside:has(a[href*="/banner/"])
 instacart.ca,instacart.com#?#div#store-wrapper div[class] > ul li:has(div[aria-label="Product"], img[alt="Sponsored"])
+instacart.ca,instacart.com#?#div#store-wrapper div.e-ijs5rh:has(span:contains(Sponsor), ul[class^="u-noscrollbar "])
comment.body:
* Please split into two rules. This is not a mistake, just we decided not to use rules with selector enumeration.

* `ul[class^="u-noscrollbar "]` matches a useful element
https://www.instacart.ca/store/super-c/storefront

<details>
<summary>Details</summary>

![image](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/8361299/0db34d28-aab2-4ddf-85c9-e4858ae68a24)


</details>

Desktop

thetimes.co.uk

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Annoyances filter

_No response_

comment.body:
А, это попап. Думал ломается сайт.

Пожалуйста, запишите HAR-файл страницы и отправьте его + ссылку на эту задачу на `filters@adguard.com`.
Как получить HAR-файл:
https://toolbox.googleapps.com/apps/har_analyzer/
После сохранения важно проверить, будет ли попап. Нужен файл именно с незаблокированным рекламным скриптом.

issue.title: Related to the "I don't care about cookies" filter
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

The "I don't care about cookies" filter description doesn't currently explain if enabling it would cause that the "cookies consent" would disapear, automatically agreeing or rejecting the cookies, including the so called "IAD" (or whatever shortcut is used for the "legitimate interest of the administrator").

In many countries, such "legitimate interest of the administrator" is a way to bypass the restrictions of the Data Protection Act and ilegally aquire and process user data

### Proposed solution

Fix the explanation and cause that the filter would automatically reject such agreement's and block such cookies

### Additional information

_No response_

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

uBO

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc.

Firefox

Desktop

thetimes.co.uk

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Annoyances filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. <comment> So depending on what article, I get 2 Annoyances (maybe it depends on if I'm visiting the website for the first time today?)
The first Article is this (https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/king-mohammed-vi-of-morocco-leads-life-of-luxury-in-france-l5076r6gh)
The second article is anything else random, for example this (https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/romania-summons-russian-ambassador-over-drone-debris-lqdtjtw00)

3. Screenshots
https://imgur.com/a/6QznQ1I

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
After reloading the second link (the article with romania), the popup didn't show up. But after closing the tab and opening it again, the pop-up still appears.
However, the annoyance still appears on the first link even after reloading

If it's useful, I can paste the filters that remove the annoyances using uBO
